id: The Wexton Campaign Responds							The Wexton Campaign Responds
paragraph:
National Review
		In response to Jennifer Wexton’s Deceitful Ad Wexton communications aide Aaron Fritschner takes angry exception to my post, noting that Comstock “voted to repeal the Affordable Care Act in full, pre-existing conditions protections included, multiple times.”That would be a fine defense if, instead of saying that Comstock “agrees” with Trump on pre-existing conditions, Wexton’s ad had said, “Barbara Comstock used to agree, at least before Trump took office, which, come to think of it, makes our whole ‘Trumpstock’ label look pretty ridiculous. . . ”Update: Fritschner has written several tweets in response to this post, and he makes one solid point: I got Wexton’s name wrong in the previous paragraph. (I had it as “Wexler,” somehow, and it’s now fixed.) Thanks for the correction, and apologies for the error. The folks behind the “Trumpstock” ad believe strongly in getting people’s last names right.NR's afternoon roundup of the day's best commentary & must-read analysis.
